availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Bigger Bibb (Franklin County, Kentucky, politician and attorney)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, politician and attorney. Prince Edward County, Virginia, native. Son of Richard Bibb and Lucy Booker Bibb. Married to Sarah P. Horsley Bibb in Henderson County, Kentucky, on August 24, 1831. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Logan County in 1827. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Logan County from 1831 to 1834. Resident of Logan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Logan County in 1850. Attorney in Franklin County in 1860. Owned forty-eight enslaved persons, including Betsy, Robertson, Peyton, Henry, Franklin, Polk, Marion, Charlotte, Sarah, Sylvia, Venus, Phil, Cornelia, Louisa, Martha, Wesley and Washington Wallace, in Franklin County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Logan County in 1860.
